intro: Cyathostemon divaricatus, commonly known as the slender cyathostemon, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal or sandy soils and thrives in well-drained conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, woody fruits. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
